section.title: Suggested work flow for processing a Service Catalog response
section.para: When your client issues a successful authentication request, the Cloud Identity Service returns a service catalog that shows the services available to that client, with one endpoint listed for each available service. (See Annotated authentication request and response for a service catalog example.)

As the client developer, you must decide how your client can use the contents of its service catalog. The first step is to identify a service that you want the client to access. Here is one possible work flow for processing the service catalog response to identify available services and their endpoints:

listitem.para: If the service catalog lists only one endpoint, use it. This endpoint connects your client to the only service available to that client.
If the service catalog lists multiple endpoints, establish a process for the client to select the endpoint for the connection:
If the user has not specified which endpoint to use, generate an error.
If the user has specified which endpoint to use, help the user identify that endpoint from within the catalog:
Support filtering by endpoint name, service name, service type, region name, and version.
Support manual specification of an endpoint via a URL parameter.

tip.para: When you parse an authentication response programmatically, use the service type instead of service name as the basis for determining whether a user has access to a particular kind of service. Service type is stable across all releases; new service types can be added, but existing service types are not renamed. If new compute services are added with different names, the service type filter returns all available services.

example.title: Connect a client to an endpoint listed as type="compute".

listitem.para: Navigate to the endpoint for the specified compute, and use its WWW-Authenticate header to determine what authentication server it uses.
Go to that authentication server and authenticate.
Return to the compute endpoint and proceed with using the compute service.
